article.headline: Texas-Arlington 75, Utah Valley St. 64
article.story: OREM, Utah -- Marquez Haynes scored a career-high 26 points to lead Texas-Arlington to a 75-64 win over Utah Valley on Saturday night. Brandon Long and Roge'r Guignard added 14 points each for the Mavericks (6-6), who led 36-27 at halftime. The Wolverines (7-6) cut the lead to 52-49 on a 3-pointer by Taylor Brown with just over 11 minutes remaining. But UTA's Trey Parker made a layup and Guignard followed with a 3-pointer to put the game out of reach. Guignard scored nine points in the final 4:20 of the game. Ryan Toolson led Utah Valley with 17 points, while Brett Ravenberg finished with 10 points and eight rebounds. Toolson, the nation's third-leading scorer, was held to 2-of-9 shooting in the first half and was 6-of-16 for the game.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
